note: Vivid and expressive, with a lovely beam of plum, anise and boysenberry notes sailing through, flanked with sweet bay leaf and violet notes and carrying through the lengthy finish. This has the grip to cellar too, but approachable now for its vivacious fruit. Drink now through 2034. 1,800 cases made. —JM                             Score 93 | Price $90

name: Masottina Extra Dry Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore RDO Rive di Ogliano
note: A fresh Prosecco, with a fine bead, layers a lightly mouthwatering acidity with a delicate mesh of ripe pear, apple blossom, stone and pink grapefruit zest aromas and flavors. Drink now. 9,800 cases made, 4,500 cases imported. —AN                             Score 90 | Price $28

name: Graeme & Julie Bott St.-Joseph White
note: Very fresh and direct in profile, with a racy beam of starfruit, white peach and yellow apple flavors liberally laced with honeysuckle and chamomile accents. name: Chalk Hill Chardonnay Sonoma Coast
note: Well-integrated flavors of Gala apple and ripe Bosc pear are swathed with creamy richness in this broad-textured style, with cooking spice accents lingering on the mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2024. 28,500 cases made. —KM                             Score 91 | Price $26

name: Louis Jadot Beaune Clos des Ursules Domaine des Héritiers
note: A lithe, well-defined red, exhibiting cherry, raspberry, earth and spice aromas and flavors. It's balanced and long, with the promise of more charm in 2-3 years. Best from 2024 through 2038. 350 cases imported. —BS                             Score 93 | Price $95

name: Boundary Breaks Riesling Finger Lakes Dry No. 239
note: A bright, floral style with lots of honeysuckle and acacia notes leading the way for lemon peel and yellow apple fruit flavors, followed by a zingy finish. Drink now through 2024. 2,500 cases made. —JM                             Score 90 | Price $20

name: Château Pradeaux Côtes de Provence Rosé
note: This is a juicy, broad, orange-hued rosé, with blood orange, orange peel and rosewater flavors backed by firm, focused acidity. name: Kinsman Eades Cabernet Sauvignon Calistoga La Voleuse du Chagrin
note: Packed with a mix of red and black currant and blackberry fruit flavors that range from compote to coulis in feel, while vibrant licorice snap, roasted apple wood and violet notes fill in throughout. Best from 2022 through 2038. 203 cases made. —JM                             Score 96 | Price $195

name: Luis Seabra Douro Xisto Ilimitado
note: Rose petal, strawberry and licorice notes are bright and elegant in this juicy red with vivid mineral undertones. name: Graci Etna
note: Rich, savory mineral notes of tarry smoke and loamy earth on the nose are layered with roasted plum, dried cherry and wild sage on the palate of this chewy, medium-bodied red. name: Bodegas Emilio Moro Godello Bierzo El Zarzal
note: This white shows finesse, offering generous layers of lychee, orange blossom, papaya and honey flavors that stay focused, with mineral, spice and herb underpinnings. name: De Wetshof Chardonnay Robertson Bon Vallon

name: Guido Berlucchi Brut Rosé Franciacorta '61
note: Enticing aromas and flavors of ripe strawberry and raspberry fruit are set on the fine, lively bead in this clean-cut, mouthwatering rosé, with a chalky underpinning. name: Château Berliquet St.-Emilion
note: This is delightful, with a fine chalky thread running through the middle of gently crushed plum and black cherry fruit flavors while sweet tobacco and bay accents hang in the background. name: Detert Cabernet Franc Oakville

name: Domaine Guiberteau Saumur White
note: Tightly wound, with cardamom, hazelnut and thyme notes gliding around the stone fruit core. The acidity is pretty intense, but it's offset by hints of wood. Needs some time. Best from 2023 through 2031. 450 cases imported. —AZ                             Score 91 | Price $27

name: Faust Cabernet Sauvignon Coombsville The Pact
note: Distinctive, with a well-defined mix of açaí berry, plum and blueberry fruit that has a cool and fresh feel, while racy graphite, dark earth, tobacco and violet accents fill in the background. name: Krug Brut Champagne
note: There’s a supernova of sensation with each sip of this powerful version, starting with the vivid streak of mouthwatering acidity that drives a rich panoply of ripe black currant, mandarin orange peel and grilled nut flavors, accented by hints of candied ginger, briny oyster shell, verbena and ground cardamom. This burns bright from start to finish, yet its fine integration and lovely, raw silk–like mousse pull it all together into a seamless, vibrant package. Pinot Noir, Pinot Meunier and Chardonnay. name: Kamen Cabernet Sauvignon Moon Mountain District Lava Block
note: Packed with warm raspberry, blackberry and fig paste flavors, this impressive version is brimming with fruit, but keeps a restrained edge as fine-grained alder and sparkles of sage and sassafras provide a counterbalance.
